cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest along the northeast Florida coast, then north toward the Georgia and South Carolina coasts before turning eastward offshore
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the northeast Florida or extreme southeast Georgia coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Sebastian Inlet to Cocoa Beach, FL and from north of Surf City to Duck, NC (including the Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Cocoa Beach, FL to Surf City, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida, Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts within the surge and wind field of Matthew
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may still bring occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (around 40 mph) to Port Everglades, but sustained hurricane-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of roughly 1â€“2 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast; levels below 3 ft near Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy squalls from outer bands could drop localized totals near or just above 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents could disrupt pilot boarding, small-craft operations, and passenger vessel movements.
